definitions.definition: To separate the threads (of); disentangle.
definitions.example: Mother couldn't unravel the ball of wool after the cat had played with it.

definitions.definition: (of threads, etc.) To become separated; (of something woven, knitted, etc.) to come apart.
To clear from complication or difficulty; to unfold; to solve.
definitions.example: to unravel a mystery

definitions.definition: To separate the connected or united parts of; to throw into disorder; to confuse.
definitions.example: to unravel the broad consensus which was created

definitions.definition: To become undone; to collapse.
Spontaneous emission of ionizing radiation as a consequence of a nuclear reaction, or directly from the breakdown of an unstable nucleus.
The radiation so emitted; including gamma rays, alpha particles, neutrons, electrons, positrons, etc.
Litre, liter
Pound (sterling) (from Latin libra)
Laughing (or laugh) out loud.
Lots of laughs. (occasionally used)
(by dilution) Indicates light-heartedness or amusement, or that the accompanying statement is not intended as serious.
(letter-writing) Lots of love.
Used in song as a nonsense syllable.
One who plants something.
A box or pot for plants, usually large and standing on the floor.
Any of the early English settlers, given the lands of the dispossessed Irish populace during the reign of Elizabeth I.
A machine used for planting seeds.
The owner of a plantation.
To render fit, suitable, or correspondent; to adapt.
definitions.example: to accommodate ourselves to circumstances

definitions.definition: To cause to come to agreement; to bring about harmony; to reconcile.
definitions.example: to accommodate differences

definitions.definition: To provide housing for.
definitions.example: to accommodate an old friend for a week

definitions.definition: To provide with something desired, needed, or convenient.
definitions.example: to accommodate a friend with a loan

definitions.definition: To do a favor or service for; to oblige.
To show the correspondence of; to apply or make suit by analogy; to adapt or fit, as teachings to accidental circumstances, statements to facts, etc.
definitions.example: to accommodate prophecy to events

definitions.definition: To give consideration to; to allow for.
To contain comfortably; to have space for.
definitions.example: This venue accommodates three hundred people.

definitions.definition: To adapt oneself; to be conformable or adapted; become adjusted.
Affording, or disposed to afford, accommodation; obliging; helpful.
Pliable; easily corrupted.
A fight.
Having the appearance of nature or realism; lifelike or realistic.
Of or relating to philosophical or methodological naturalism.
A racquet: an implement with a handle connected to a round frame strung with wire, sinew, or plastic cords, and used to hit a ball, such as in tennis or a birdie in badminton.
A snowshoe formed of cords stretched across a long and narrow frame of light wood.
A broad wooden shoe or patten for a man or horse, to allow walking on marshy or soft ground.
To strike with, or as if with, a racket.
A loud noise.
definitions.example: Power tools work quickly, but they sure make a racket.

definitions.definition: A fraud or swindle; an illegal scheme for profit.
definitions.example: They had quite a racket devised to relieve customers of their money.

definitions.definition: A carouse; any reckless dissipation.
Something taking place considered as exciting, trying, unusual, etc. or as an ordeal.
To make a clattering noise.
To be dissipated; to carouse.
To restore a friendly relationship; to bring back to harmony.
definitions.example: to reconcile people who have quarrelled

definitions.definition: To make things compatible or consistent.
definitions.example: to reconcile differences

definitions.definition: To make the net difference in credits and debits of a financial account agree with the balance.
A male artisan.
To misbehave.
definitions.example: Children who do not receive enough attention may begin to play up.

definitions.definition: To make or attempt to make something appear more important, likely or obvious; to showcase or highlight.
definitions.example: For the audition, Nicole will play up her skill as a pianist by playing Jesu, Joy of Man's Desiring by Bach.

definitions.definition: To play more vigorously.
To be unfaithful to a lover; to cheat; used with on.
To put forth effort to meet (usually arbitrary) requirements set by someone.
definitions.example: They really made the salesman jump through hoops before buying anything.

definitions.definition: The leader of an Arab village, family or small tribe.
An Islamic religious cleric; the leader of an Islamic religious order.
(some Arab Gulf countries) An official title for members of the royal family as well as some prominent families.
(1920s) A romantic lover. (from the 1921 film The Sheik)
An Arab, especially one dressed in traditional clothing.
An honorific for specialists in spirituality.
A type of biscuit or cracker which is baked using only flour and water, without shortening or other fats
A stringed musical instrument (chordophone), usually with a round body, a membrane-like soundboard and a fretted neck, played by plucking or strumming the strings.
definitions.example: I come from Alabama with my banjo on my knee...

definitions.definition: Any of various similar musical instruments, such as the Tuvan doshpuluur, with a membrane-like soundboard.
An object shaped like a banjo, especially a frying pan or a shovel.
(Dagenham) A cul-de-sac with a round end.
To play a banjo.
To beat, to knock down.
To shell or attack (a target).
A nerve fibre which is a long slender projection of a nerve cell, and which conducts nerve impulses away from the body of the cell to a synapse.
A fundamental particle; any of the subatomic particles that do not consist of other, smaller particles; the gauge bosons, leptons and quarks.
One who studies zoology.
Any temporary dwelling; a hut, tent, or booth.
The portable tent used before the construction of the temple, where the shekinah (presence of God) was believed to dwell.
(by extension) The Jewish Temple at Jerusalem (as continuing the functions of the earlier tabernacle).
Any portable shrine used in heathen or idolatrous worship.
A sukkah, the booth or 'tabernacle' used during the Jewish Feast of Sukkot.
A small ornamented cupboard or box used for the reserved sacrament of the Eucharist, normally located in an especially prominent place in a Roman Catholic church.
A temporary place of worship, especially a tent, for a tent meeting, as with a venue for revival meetings.
(by extension) Any house of worship; used especially of Mormon churches.
Any abode or dwelling place, or especially the human body as the temporary dwelling place of the soul, or life.
A hinged device allowing for the easy folding of a mast 90 degrees from perpendicular, as for transporting the boat on a trailer, or passing under a bridge.
To dwell; to abide for a time.
(usually in the plural) Any material made of interlacing fibres, including carpeting and geotextiles.
(naturism) A non-nudist.
(naturism) Clothing compulsive.
definitions.example: A textile beach

definitions.definition: The collective body of foreign diplomats accredited to a particular country or body.
To pull something, so that it comes inside.
definitions.example: After falling out of the boat, the crew pulled him in.

definitions.definition: (of a vehicle) To approach or drive up to a place and come to a stop.
definitions.example: A car just pulled in our driveway.

definitions.definition: (of a train or bus) To approach a station; to arrive at a station.
definitions.example: Quick! The train's pulling in.

definitions.definition: To arrest someone; to take somoene to a police station because they may have done something.
definitions.example: She was pulled in for questioning.

definitions.definition: To earn [money].
definitions.example: He pulls in a lot of money.

definitions.definition: To tighten a sail by pulling on a rope.
definitions.example: pull in the main sheet

definitions.definition: A large room for public meetings or performances.
(in a theater, etc.) The space where the audience is located.
An athletics discipline that takes place on the track, such as a sprint, steeplechase
A cowhand (one who tends free-range cattle)

A 19th-century device used around the necks of cows and other livestock to prevent them from challenging fencing. The action of the device was to poke the cow when the device came into contact with the fence.
To eat too much.
To surfeit with eating.
Gluttony, the act of eating to excess.
A person who does not believe in deities.
A person who does not believe in a particular deity (or any deity in a particular pantheon), notwithstanding that they may believe in another deity.
Of or relating to atheists or atheism; atheistic.
To cause to feel less close or friendly; alienate. To cease contact with (particularly of a family member or spouse, especially in form estranged).
To remove from an accustomed place or set of associations.
Having become a stranger, of one who formerly was close, as a relative, friend, lover, or spouse.
To lay upon, as an order or command; to give an injunction to; to direct with authority; to order; to charge.
To prohibit or restrain by a judicial order or decree; to put an injunction on.
A person who plays the trombone.
The officer (or warrant officer) in charge of sails, rigging, anchors, cables etc. and all work on deck of a sailing ship.
The petty officer of a merchant ship who controls the work of other seamen.
A kind of gull, the jaeger.
The tropicbird.
The staircase and landing or porch leading to the entrance of a residence.
The threshold of a doorway, a doorstep.
A stooping, bent position of the body.
definitions.example: The old man walked with a stoop.

definitions.definition: An accelerated descent in flight, as that for an attack.
To bend the upper part of the body forward and downward to a half-squatting position; crouch.
definitions.example: He stooped to tie his shoe-laces.

definitions.definition: To lower oneself; to demean or do something below one's status, standards, or morals.
definitions.example: Can you believe that a salesman would stoop so low as to hide his customers' car keys until they agreed to the purchase?

definitions.definition: Of a bird of prey: to swoop down on its prey.
To cause to incline downward; to slant.
definitions.example: to stoop a cask of liquor

definitions.definition: To cause to submit; to prostrate.
To yield; to submit; to bend, as by compulsion; to assume a position of humility or subjection.
To descend from rank or dignity; to condescend.
To degrade.
A post or pillar, especially a gatepost or a support in a mine.
A vessel for holding liquids; a flagon.
A piece of land projecting into water from a larger land mass.
To occupy fully, to take up all of.
To add contents to (a container, cavity or the like) so that it is full.
To enter (something), making it full.
To become full.
definitions.example: the bucket filled with rain;  the sails fill with wind

definitions.definition: To become pervaded with something.
definitions.example: My heart filled with joy.

definitions.definition: To satisfy or obey (an order, request or requirement).
definitions.example: The pharmacist filled my prescription for penicillin.

definitions.definition: To install someone, or be installed, in (a position or office), eliminating a vacancy.
definitions.example: Sorry, no more applicants. The position has been filled.

definitions.definition: To treat (a tooth) by adding a dental filling to it.
definitions.example: Dr. Smith filled Jim's cavity with silver amalgam.

definitions.definition: To fill or supply fully with food; to feed; to satisfy.
To trim (a yard) so that the wind blows on the after side of the sails.
(of a male) To have sexual intercourse with (a female).
definitions.example: Did you fill that girl last night?

definitions.definition: Anything that is used to fill something.
The contents of a pie, etc.
Any material used to fill a cavity in a tooth or the result of using such material.
definitions.example: I will be using a rapid-setting cement filling.

definitions.definition: The woof in woven fabrics.
Prepared wort added to ale to cleanse it.
A religious experience attributed to the Holy Ghost "filling" a believer.
Of food, that satisfies the appetite by filling the stomach.
definitions.example: a filling meal

definitions.definition: The act of furthering or helping forward
Promotion.
Advancement or progress.
To become dry (often of weather); to lose water.
definitions.example: I'll go shopping when it dries up.

definitions.definition: To cause to become dry.
definitions.example: The heatwave dried up all the rivers.

definitions.definition: To manually dry dishes.
To deprive someone of (something vital).
definitions.example: The bankruptcy rumor dried up his sales.

definitions.definition: To cease to exist; to disappear
definitions.example: When our money dried up, we had to get proper jobs.

definitions.definition: To stop talking; to forget what one was going to say.
definitions.example: This surprised me so much that I dried up for a moment.

definitions.definition: A headfirst fall or jump.
A rapid fall in price or value.
(of aircraft) To dive down in a steep angle.
To perform a rapid fall in price or value.
Having a muscular physique
Aggressively self-confident or assertive; bullheaded
definitions.example: He was heavily criticised for his bullish behaviour.

definitions.definition: (of the price of financial instruments) Characterized by rising value.
Optimistic; overly or foolishly optimistic or hopeful
Able to be fancied; sexually attractive.
A light boot, fitted with a blade, used for ice skating.
A blow that causes the recipient to fall or move backwards, a knock back; a recoil.
Something that impedes or reverses progress; a setback.
A rejection; a refusal.
definitions.example: He got a few knockbacks today when he tried to give his resume out at the local shops.

definitions.definition: A small, usually yellow, finch (genus Serinus), a songbird native to the Canary Islands.
Any of various small birds of different countries, most of which are largely yellow in colour.
A light, slightly greenish, yellow colour.
A light, sweet, white wine from the Canary Islands.
A lively dance, possibly of Spanish origin (also called canaries).
Any test subject, especially an inadvertent or unwilling one. (From the mining practice of using canaries to detect dangerous gases.)
A value placed in memory such that it will be the first data corrupted by a buffer overflow, allowing the program to identify and recover from it.
A female singer, soprano, a coloratura singer.
An informer or snitch; a squealer.
A (usually yellow) capsule of the short-acting barbiturate pentobarbital/pentobarbitone (Nembutal).
A yellow sticker of unroadworthiness.
To dance nimbly (as in the canary dance)
To inform or snitch, to betray secrets, especially about illegal activities.
Of a light yellow colour.
The amount of rain that falls on a single occasion
The occurrence of liquid precipitation, the fall of rain.
Any of the many species of arching shrubs and climbing vines of the genus Lonicera in the Caprifoliaceae family, many with sweet smelling, bell shaped flowers.
Any of several species of similar plants from Australia
A sharp, shrill outcry or scream; a shrill wild cry such as is caused by sudden or extreme terror, pain, or the like.
An exclamation mark.
To utter a loud, sharp, shrill sound or cry, as do some birds and beasts; to scream, as in a sudden fright, in horror or anguish.
To utter sharply and shrilly; to utter in or with a shriek or shrieks.
A resource that is not renewable.
Not able to be renewed; incapable of renewal.
(With respect to a resource) unsustainable; not able to be regrown or renewed; not having an ongoing or continuous source of supply
definitions.example: Coal is nonrenewable.

definitions.definition: Any flat, thin piece of clay, ivory, metal, etc., used for ornament, or for painting pictures upon, as a dish, plate, slab, etc., hung upon a wall; also, a smaller decoration worn by a person, such as a brooch.
A piece of flat metal with writing on it, attached to a building, monument, or other structure to remind people of a person or an event.
A small card representing an amount of money, used for betting in casinos; a sort of gaming chip.
A clearing in a bacterial lawn caused by a virus.
In the Hornbostel–Sachs classification system: any flat, thin musical instrument.
definitions.example: blown plaques  concussion plaques

definitions.definition: A broad patch of abnormal tissue distinguishable from surrounding tissue, especially a broad papule on the skin.
An abnormal accumulation of material in or on an organ of the body, often associated with disease.
definitions.example: amyloid plaque  pleural plaque  senile plaque

definitions.definition: A house owned not as a primary residence and used as vacation home during warm weather months of the year.
An outbuilding in a garden where the owners can relax in warm weather.
One who illegally sells drugs.
One billion hertz, 109 Hz.

The forms required by a good upbringing, or prescribed by authority, to be observed in social or official life; observance of the proprieties of rank and occasion; conventional decorum; ceremonial code of polite society.
The customary behavior of members of a profession, business, law, or sports team towards each other.
A label used to indicate that a letter is to be sent by airmail.
Having self-contradictory properties.
A rearrangement of an older piece of music, possibly including various cosmetic changes.
A piece of music formed by combining existing pieces of music together, possibly including various other cosmetic changes
To mix again.
To create a remix.
To rearrange or radically alter (a particular piece of music).
To modify (a work in any medium).

A close embrace, especially when charged with such an emotion as represented by: affection, joy, relief, lust, anger, agression, compassion, and the like, as opposed to being characterized by formality, equivocation or ambivalence (a half-embrace or "little hug").
A particular grip in wrestling.
To crouch; huddle as with cold.
To cling closely together.
To embrace by holding closely, especially in the arms.
definitions.example: Billy hugged Danny until he felt better.

definitions.definition: To stay close to (the shore etc.)
To hold fast; to cling to; to cherish.

Citrus fruit variant of jam but distinguished by being made slightly bitter by the addition of the peel and by partial caramelisation during manufacture. Most commonly made with Seville oranges, and usually qualified by the name of the fruit when made with other types of fruit.
definitions.example: lime marmalade

definitions.definition: To spread marmalade on.
Stretch limousine
Gathering.
Showing.
To show, exhibit.
To be gathered together for parade, inspection, exercise, or the like (especially of a military force); to come together as parts of a force or body.
To collect, call or assemble together, such as troops or a group for inspection, orders, display etc.
To enroll (into service).
To gather or round up livestock.
A person of one-eighth African ancestry.
In warfare, an agreed end to hostilities for a specific purpose. (Typically only temporary).
definitions.example: The rebels agreed to a ceasefire while the peace talks were underway.

definitions.definition: To assemble the parts of a mechanism, especially by connecting wires.
To connect to something like a power supply or a signal source.
(used with "with") To form an association (with) someone.
(used with "with") To have a casual sexual experience with another person, usually without any future relationship intended.
To supply someone with goods or services.
definitions.example: Hey man, can you hook me up with some weed?

definitions.definition: A shop that sells cooked or prepared food ready for serving.
definitions.example: Delis usually offer a broader, fresher menu than fast food chains.

definitions.definition: Food sold at a delicatessen.
The action of stopping operations; a closing, of a computer, business, event, etc.
definitions.example: You need to enter your password at startup, but it's not required at shutdown.

definitions.definition: A statement, insult, etc. that prevents the opponent from replying further.
definitions.example: When he insulted me, my reply was such a shutdown that he left the room.

definitions.definition: An autistic response to stress, etc. where the individual becomes silent and motionless.
A turn of 180 degrees, typically in a military formation.
Total reversal of opinion or attitude.
To turn 180 degrees, typically in a military formation.
A company that provides a service.
An ungainly person or thing.
Clumsy; lacking grace.
Difficult to move or to manage; unwieldy.
Unsuitable; unprofitable.
In an ungainly or unbecoming manner; improperly; undeservedly, unduly; unsuitably.
A tabular schedule of events with the times at which they occur, especially times of arrivals and departures
definitions.example: The timetable has been changed several times since it was first announced.

definitions.definition: To arrange a specific time for (an event, a class, etc).
definitions.example: I've timetabled the meeting for Monday afternoon.

definitions.definition: Research performed in detail on a single individual, group, incident or community, as opposed to, for instance, a sample of the whole population.
A case used in a such research.
A decorative horizontal stripe on the bodywork of a vehicle, imitating those found on racing cars.
A firework designed to produce smoke upon ignition.
An explosive or incendiary device designed to produce smoke in order to mark a position or produce a smokescreen.
Any strepsirrhine primate of the infraorder Lemuriformes, superfamily Lemuroidea, native only to Madagascar and some surrounding islands.
Any of the genus Lemur, represented by the ring-tailed lemur (Lemur catta).
A loris (Lemur tardigradus, now Loris tardigradus), predating the 10th edition of Systema Naturæ.

(games) A type of game where one or more players assume the roles of characters (usually one each) to interact with a fictional world either defined by themselves or through the moderation of a neutral judge (usually referred to as as the game master).

A type of computer game where the player takes the role of a character or party, normally lacking tests of physical skill and including more story-telling and narrative aspects than traditional action games.
A place in a restaurant, bar, or shop etc, typically containing a cash register, where a customer can pay the bill.
The traits acquired during one's childhood training
The raising or training of a child.
definitions.example: Through her upbringing, Mildred's father had carefully programmed her to expect very little from life.

definitions.definition: The art or process of working with a needle esp. in embroidery or needlepoint.
The product of such art or process.
The occupation or employment of a person skilled in embroidery, needlepoint, etc.
The decayed remains of organic matter that has rotted into a natural fertilizer.
definitions.example: Dig plenty of compost into clay or sandy soil to improve its structure.

definitions.definition: A mixture; a compound.
To produce compost, let organic matter decay into fertilizer.
definitions.example: If you compost your grass clippings, you can improve your soil.

definitions.definition: One who rushes or hurries; an energetic person.
Somebody who pretends to be an amateur at a game in order to win bets.
A pimp.
A prostitute.
A charlatan, huckster, grifter, a scoundrel.
The flat vertical surface to which the basket is attached.
A flat vertical wall with the image of a tennis net drawn or painted on it. Designed to practice hitting against such that the ball bounces back.
(first aid) A spine board.
A board placed at the back of a cart, boat, etc.
The port or larboard side of a ship
The act of restraining oneself.
The act of abstaining; a holding aloof; refraining from.
The act of declining to vote on a particular issue.
Non-participation in the political world; as a country avoiding international affairs.
A great flood or rain.
definitions.example: The deluge continued for hours, drenching the land and slowing traffic to a halt.

definitions.definition: An overwhelming amount of something; anything that overwhelms or causes great destruction.
definitions.example: The rock concert was a deluge of sound.

definitions.definition: (military engineering) A damage control system on navy warships which is activated by excessive temperature within the Vertical Launching System.
To flood with water.
definitions.example: Some areas were deluged with a month's worth of rain in 24 hours.

definitions.definition: To overwhelm.
definitions.example: After the announcement, they were deluged with requests for more information.
